intro: Elaphoglossum petiolosum, commonly known as the slender holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 30–60 cm long. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces spore-bearing sorus clusters on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The fronds are usually dark green and have a finely divided, feather-like appearance.
